Package src

Class Chunk

java.lang.Object
src.Chunk
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
public class Chunk extends Object implements GameVariables
Chunk holds an nxn array of PositionBlocks and stores the x and y position of the entire array. The draw() method draws all position blocks in the array. It handles collision detection of each block within itself, keeps track of its x and y position, and determines if it's a starting or ending chunk. Implements the GameVariables interface.
Since:
March 2, 2024
Author:
Nick Clouse, Andrew Denegar, Molly O'Connor
See Also:

    • Chunk

      public Chunk(int xDimension, int yDimension, int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Constructs a new Chunk with given dimensions and coordinates.
      Parameters:
      xDimension - number of columns in chunk.
      yDimension - number of rows in chunk.
      xPosition - the top-left x-coordinate of the chunk.
      yPosition - the top-left y-coordinate of the chunk.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(int xPosition, int yPosition, PositionBlock block)
      Adds a position block to the chunk with position (xPosition, yPosition).
      Parameters:
      xPosition - the x-coordinate of the block within the chunk.
      yPosition - the y-coordinate of the block within the chunk.
      block - the PositionBlock to add.

    • updateCoords

      public void updateCoords(int dx, int dy)
